results.title: The Iced hopes of Dr Calastein
results.creator_credit: Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative, Hobart Hughes and Bruce Currie
results.brief_description: Calestein returns to his underground laboratory to continue work on his beloved virus. A day not unlike any other and yet today is different. Somehow things have gone to far, and those outside and above think its time to have a few words with Dr Calestein.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative, Hobart Hughes and Bruce Currie

results.title: The Icarus wish
results.brief_description: The awe of flight, the wonder of a bird, the freedom of riding a current of air. Multiple screen images condense the emotions of two boys of different cultures. A jet liner, a bird, a kite and a paper airplane are the segments of this non-verbal adventure in visual literacy.

results.title: The Hydra
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Julian Huxley and Percy Smith
results.brief_description: The first part of this film studies the natural surroundings of the hydra, and the structure of the organism and the second part focuses on the process of regeneration after bisection, the manner in which food is caught and digested, sexual reproduction by eggs and sperm, and a sexual reproduction by budding.

results.title: The Huntsman
results.brief_description: A film adaptation of a short story by Toronto writer David Lewis Stein about a ten-year-old boy who ferrets out golf balls from the rough, then sells his findings to passing golfers. There is an unexpected development when two unscrupulous older boys try to muscle in on his business. A children’s film, but one that many adults will enjoy.

results.title: The Hunters
results.creator_credit: Film Study Center of the Peabody museum of Harvard University and John Marshall
results.brief_description: A study of the life and culture of four indigenous African bushmen as they hunt a giraffe and other game in the Kalahari Desert. Shows the difficulties of survival in a desert region and the skills displayed by the bushmen. Suitable for secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Study Center of the Peabody museum of Harvard University and John Marshall

results.title: The Hunter (D)
results.brief_description: Set in the farming district of the Coolah Valley, New South Wales, this short fictional film is an indictment of the senseless and indiscriminate shooting of kangaroos, purportedly for sport or recreational value, which sometimes takes place out in the Australian bush. With John Shellabear. WARNING: CONTAINS SOME DISTURBING SCENES.

results.title: The Hungry miles
results.creator_credit: Waterside Workers' Federation of Australia. Film Unit., Norma Disher, Keith Gow and Jerome Levy
results.brief_description: A passionate survey of the struggles and achievements of the Waterside Workers Federation including some striking scenes of the depression (reconstructed by the WWF Film Unit with amateur actors), showing the impact of the economic hardships of the 1930s on the union and its members.

results.title: The Hundredth monkey
results.brief_description: We all want to know what we can do about peace but few feel we can really make a difference. The Hundredth Monkey Phenomenon proves we can. The film reviews the research that shows how the thoughts of individuals affect the world. While feeding monkeys sweet potatoes on a Japanese island, a group of scientists discovered that when a critical number of monkeys learned a behaviour, all the monkeys in the tribe began exhibiting the same behaviour - without being taught. Ken Keyes brought attention to this research with his book “The Hundredth monkey”, and he introduces the concept in this film. Both the book and the video support the notion that when awareness of an idea reaches a critical level, this awareness spreads exponentially and becomes universal.

results.title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame (Silent)
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Carl Laemmle, Irving G. Thalberg and Wallace Worsley
results.brief_description: This classic silent film of the Victor Hugo novel is a masterpiece of film-making. Lon Chaney as the hunchback Quasimodo was grotesque and pathetic. The actor suffered for his art in a rubber suit weighing over seventy pounds. Dubbed “The man of a thousand faces”, Chaney’s portrayal of Quasimodo is not the only outstanding feature of this production. The set which took a year to build, the enormous cast of extras, adds to the epic grandeur of the film. Starring Brandon Hurst, Nigel De Brulier and Patsy Ruth Miller as Esmeralda.

results.title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame (Laughton)
results.creator_credit: Pandro S. Berman and William Dieterle
results.brief_description: William Dieterle’s film of Victor Hugo’s magnificent novel “Notre Dame de Paris” is a beautifully fashioned, powerful and dramatic work with an unforgettable visual impression. Charles Laughton plays Quasimodo, the hideously deformed, tragic hunchback. Maureen O’Hara plays the enchanting Esmeralda. Rated: PG
